title: BBC newsreader Kate Silverton apologises after accidentally revealing Strictly result early
text:

BBC newsreader Kate Silverton was forced to apologise today after accidentally revealing the Strictly result two hours early.

The 49-year-old, who appeared on the BBC dancing show last year, retweeted a spoiler to her followers today as she watched the show on BBC iPlayer .

After realising her mistake, she took to social media to apologise for ruining the "wonderful Strictly magic".

She tweeted: "Oh my goodness - I have spent the day with my family offline & and just catching up with this - as someone who clearly knows all too well the fundamental issue around #stricrlyspoilers I hand on heart can say this was an entirely unintentional ‘retweet’."

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

Kate added: "I was watching with my mum on catch up - last midnight so with tired eyes... I certainly don’t retweet anything like this as my followers will know but for anyone who has had their wonderful @bbcstrictly magic ruined I must apologise & again pls accept as entirely unintentional."

Strictly's celebrity exit has already been leaked on social media and has left fans utterly shocked.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: PA)

Fans flocked to Twitter in horror after discovering who has gone out, with some questioning whether it was "a joke".

While Strictly's results show airs on Sundays, it is filmed on the Saturday after the main show. This means that the result is often leaked by members of the public who have gone to watch the show.

The Mirror knows who is going out but we are keeping it under wraps for those who want to find out tomorrow.

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

One fan tweeted: "Absolutely shocked as to who has gone out this week, disappointed that it was this particular person. Felt they could have gone further. #StrictlySpoiler."

While another commented: "Wasn’t expecting that #strictlyspoiler."

A third remarked: "Is this a joke? #strictlyspoiler."

"Wow shocked at the bottom two, but not surprised given so many people improved, I blame the dance choice, one bad week and you're out #strictly #strictlyspoiler #scd," another wrote.

Another commented: "Just saw the Strictly spoiler for this week and I’m in shock!!"

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: PA)

Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden soared to the top of the leaderboard after their week four passionate Tango performance tonight.

Two points behind were Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse, who scored 36 for their saucy Rumba performance.

At the other end of the table are Alex Scott and Neil Jones, who finished last on the leaderboard with 23.

*Strictly Come Dancing returns tonight at 7.15pm on BBC One
description: Kate, who appeared on the BBC dancing show last year, retweeted a spoiler to her followers today as she watched the show on BBC iPlayer
